content.description: Two hand start. End on a chossy top out. Fun problem!
content.location: There is a tree on the lip of the face. It is a few feet to the left of that.

content.description: Fun route on a really distinctive rock. Plenty of other options here. A little chossy and the top out is optional.
content.location: At the beginning of Bluffview trail, maybe a quarter mile up the main trail from the Al Foster boulder. Big overhanging rock, start on the right side

content.description: Great problem! Two hand start, finish with a match. A top out would be really awesome but would be incredibly dangerous and difficult.
content.protection: At least two pads. We did it with one spotter but another would have been nice. Watch out for the hill on as the name says, you might roll.
content.location: underneath the biggest ledge. The area is to the left of the bluff.

content.description: Start with hands in the horizontal crack to the upper right of the starting crack of Bananas Foster, make a big reach left to a big pocket (with perhaps a bump along the way), then cross the right hand over to a nice little ledge, then cross the left hand over to the starting crack of Bananas Foster, then bring the right hand over to that crack and finish Bananas Foster by traversing to the far left of that crack before topping out.
content.protection: Crashpads for the start and topout.
content.location: Start with hands in the horizontal crack to the upper right of the starting crack of Bananas Foster.

content.description: Start on the lookers left side of the bluff with both hands on a wide, obvious ledge. Traverse from the far right of the ledge to the far left. Once you are all the way to the left of the ledge, a large pocket on your left and jug to your right provide the first holds creating vertical progress. Bump the right hand to a crimp and then lock off the right arm for a chossy top out.
Double undercling start. Work up to undercling pocket,crimp and bump to right Gaston. Finish left ledge match. Might be able to top it out, but would up the grade.
content.location: pockets just left of the large overhang.

content.description: Long overhanging boulder with good shade and access
